scenario_name: 2025 GlobalTech FY25 Sales & Product Innovation Kickoff
company_context: GlobalTech Solutions is a mid‑size (≈1,200 employees) technology firm specializing in cloud‑based SaaS platforms for the financial services sector. The FY25 Kickoff is hosted by the GlobalTech Go‑to‑Market (GTM) organization, which includes 150 members across Product Management, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Operations. The GTM team reports to the Chief Commercial Officer and is structured into three product lines (Core Banking, Risk Analytics, and Payments) plus a cross‑functional Enablement squad.
meeting_event_details: June 10‑12, 2025 (3 days). Day 1: 08:00‑18:00, Day 2: 08:30‑19:00, Day 3: 09:00‑16:00. Venue: Hyatt Regency Denver, 650 17th Street, Denver, CO – Main Ballroom for plenary sessions, three breakout rooms (North, South, West), and the rooftop terrace for the welcome reception. All times are Mountain Daylight Time (MDT).
stakeholders: Laura Martinez – Chief Executive Officer (overall sponsor, opening keynote)
Raj Patel – Chief Financial Officer (budget sign‑off, FY25 financial outlook)
Megan O'Connor – Chief Commercial Officer (event owner, success metrics)
Diego Alvarez – VP, Product Management (product line strategy presentations)
Sofia Liu – VP, Global Sales (sales targets and enablement plan)
Ethan Brooks – VP, Marketing (brand and demand‑gen roadmap)
Nina Gupta – Director, Customer Success (customer insights session)
Tommy Reed – Senior Program Manager, Events (logistics lead)
Karen Whitfield – HR Business Partner (team‑building activities)
Alexis Chen – External Keynote Speaker, Gartner Analyst (industry trends)
Javier Morales – AV & Production Lead (live‑streaming, recording)
Olivia Bennett – Procurement Lead (catering, swag, contracts)
deliverables: Master Kickoff Deck (incl. agenda, speaker bios, branding)
FY25 GTM Strategic Roadmap (PDF & interactive PowerPoint)
Product Launch Playbook for the new Payments API (docx)
Cross‑functional OKR matrix (Excel) with owners and timelines
Recorded video of all plenary sessions uploaded to the internal LMS
Post‑event Survey Report (response rate, NPS, qualitative feedback)
Event Logistics Pack (venue contracts, floor plan, catering menus, swag inventory)
Budget Reconciliation Report (actual vs. planned spend)
success_criteria: ≥ 95 % of invited GTM team members attend in‑person or via live stream
Overall event satisfaction score ≥ 4.5/5 on post‑event survey
Net Promoter Score (NPS) for the kickoff ≥ 70
At least 3 new cross‑functional initiatives identified and documented in the OKR matrix
All key deliverables (roadmap, playbook, OKRs) completed and shared within 5 business days after the event
Event executed within the approved budget of $120,000 (± 5 %)
Zero critical AV or catering incidents reported during the three days
constraints: Planning horizon T‑60 (finalized plan must be locked by April 11, 2025)
Total budget capped at $120,000, inclusive of venue, catering, AV, travel subsidies, and swag
Venue capacity limited to 200 on‑site attendees; remote participation limited to 50 concurrent streams
All external vendors must be vetted through GlobalTech’s preferred supplier list
COVID‑19 contingency: must have a backup virtual‑only format ready within 48 hours of any health‑related restriction
Swag items must be ESG‑compliant (recyclable packaging, no single‑use plastics)
workback_prompt: Create a detailed work‑back plan for the 2025 GlobalTech FY25 Sales & Product Innovation Kickoff (June 10‑12, 2025, Hyatt Regency Denver). Include all major work‑streams (strategy alignment, speaker coordination, venue & AV, catering, swag procurement, travel logistics, communications, on‑site execution, post‑event deliverables), key milestones, dependencies, owners, and estimated effort. Align the plan with the T‑60 planning horizon, $120k budget, and the success criteria listed. Provide a Gantt‑style timeline (by week) and a risk mitigation matrix for the identified constraints.

scenario_name: Quantum Analytics FY2025 Annual Kickoff – “Data‑Driven Horizons”
company_context: Quantum Analytics is a mid‑size SaaS company (350 employees) that provides advanced data‑analytics platforms to large financial institutions. The Product & Engineering organization consists of 80 members across three squads (Core Platform, AI Insights, and Client Integrations) and reports to VP of Product, Maya Patel. The FY2025 Annual Kickoff is the flagship event for aligning strategy, launching the product roadmap, and strengthening cross‑functional collaboration.
meeting_event_details: June 10‑12, 2025 (Thursday‑Saturday) • 09:00‑17:00 each day • Venue: The Lodge at Pebble Beach, 1700 17th St, Pebble Beach, CA 93953 • Theme: “Data‑Driven Horizons” • Objectives: (1) Communicate FY2025 corporate and product strategy, (2) Finalize OKRs for all squads, (3) Introduce the new AI‑Insights product line, (4) Foster team cohesion through off‑site activities, (5) Capture actionable feedback for continuous improvement.
stakeholders: Ethan Reynolds – CEO – Sets overall vision, delivers opening keynote, approves budget.
Maya Patel – VP of Product – Owns agenda, leads product roadmap presentation, signs off on OKRs.
Liam O'Connor – CTO – Presents technology strategy, oversees technical deep‑dive sessions.
Sofia Martinez – Director of Sales – Shares market outlook, revenue targets, and sales enablement plan.
Ravi Singh – Head of Customer Success – Presents NPS goals, key client stories, and support roadmap.
Dr. Elena Kwon – External Industry Analyst (Guest Speaker) – Provides market trend insights.
Olivia Chen – Senior Program Manager (Event Lead) – Coordinates logistics, vendor contracts, and on‑site execution.
Jamal Brooks – Lead Designer – Designs visual assets, swag, and presentation templates.
Karen Liu – HR Business Partner – Organizes team‑building activities and DEI workshops.
Victor Alvarez – Finance Manager – Tracks budget, invoices, and cost variance.
deliverables: Master kickoff agenda and detailed run‑of‑show (PDF).
FY2025 corporate strategy deck (PowerPoint).
Product roadmap presentation with timelines and feature owners (PowerPoint).
OKR workbook for each squad (Google Sheet) signed off by squad leads.
Recorded video of all sessions uploaded to internal LMS.
Post‑event survey report with Net Promoter Score and action items.
Swag package (branded notebook, reusable water bottle, laptop stickers) delivered to each attendee.
Final expense report vs. $150,000 budget cap.
success_criteria: ≥ 95% of invited team members attend in person or via live stream.
Average post‑event satisfaction rating ≥ 4.5/5.
All squad OKRs approved and uploaded within 48 hours of event close.
Budget variance ≤ 5% of the $150k cap.
Net Promoter Score (NPS) for the event ≥ 70.
≥ 80% of participants complete the post‑event survey.
Zero critical AV or catering incidents reported.
constraints: Total event budget limited to $150,000 (venue, travel, catering, AV, swag).
Venue contract must be signed by March 31, 2025.
All travel arrangements must comply with the company’s new carbon‑offset policy.
Key speakers (CEO, CTO, VP of Product) have limited availability – must lock speaking slots by April 15.
COVID‑19 contingency plan required: hybrid streaming capacity for up to 30 remote participants.
Swag must be sourced from vendors with a minimum 30% women‑owned or minority‑owned business participation.
workback_prompt: Using the detailed scenario above for Quantum Analytics' FY2025 Annual Kickoff (June 10‑12, 2025, high‑complexity, T‑60 planning horizon), create a comprehensive work‑back plan that lists every task, responsible owner, start and finish dates, dependencies, required resources, risk mitigation steps, and key milestones. Include sections for pre‑event planning (venue booking, speaker confirmations, travel logistics), event‑day execution (AV setup, catering, session facilitation), and post‑event wrap‑up (survey analysis, OKR finalization, financial close). Ensure the plan aligns with the budget, timeline, and success criteria provided.

scenario_name: TechNova AI Solutions – 2025 Global Product Innovation Annual Kickoff
company_context: TechNova AI Solutions is a mid‑size (≈850 employees) SaaS company specializing in AI‑driven workflow automation for enterprise customers. The Global Product Innovation (GPI) team consists of 120 members across three sub‑teams: Core Platform (45), Industry Solutions (50), and Customer Success Engineering (25). The GPI team reports to the VP of Product and collaborates closely with Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Legal.
meeting_event_details:
June 10‑12, 2025 (3 days) – Aspen Mountain Resort, Snowmass, Colorado, USA. 
Day 1 (June 10) 08:30‑18:00 – Strategy & Vision. 
Day 2 (June 11) 09:00‑19:00 – Roadmap Workshops & Cross‑Team Hackathon. 
Day 3 (June 12) 09:00‑15:00 – OKR Alignment, Team‑Building Activities, Closing Ceremony. 
All sessions are in the Grand Ballroom (capacity 200) with breakout rooms on each floor. Evening networking receptions are held in the resort’s Alpine Lounge.
stakeholders: Maya Patel – Chief Executive Officer – Executive sponsor, final approval of budget and strategic direction
Carlos Ramirez – Chief Technology Officer – Keynote speaker on technology trends, oversees technical feasibility reviews
Leah Chen – Vice President, Product – Owner of the kickoff agenda, leads roadmap presentations
Rohan Singh – Director, Core Platform – Facilitates Core Platform breakout sessions
Aisha Al‑Mansour – Director, Industry Solutions – Leads industry‑specific workshops
Diego Torres – Director, Customer Success Engineering – Coordinates customer‑centric demos and success metrics
Natalie Brooks – Senior Program Manager, GPI – Responsible for logistics, vendor management, and on‑site execution
Jenna Lee – Head of People & Culture – Designs team‑building activities and ensures DEI considerations
Markus Vogel – AV & Production Lead (External Vendor) – Manages all audio‑visual and live‑streaming needs
Sofia Alvarez – Marketing Communications Manager – Produces event swag, branding, and post‑event communications
deliverables: Master Kickoff Deck (PDF) containing vision, market insights, and strategic priorities
2025 Product Roadmap (interactive PDF) approved by all sub‑team leads
GPI OKR Sheet (Google Sheet) with measurable objectives for Q1‑Q4 2025
Recorded video of all keynote and breakout sessions (uploaded to internal LMS)
Post‑event Survey Report (PDF) with Net Promoter Score and actionable feedback
Action‑Item Tracker (Jira) with owners, due dates, and status for each initiative identified during the hackathon
Swag Kit (branded notebook, reusable water bottle, RFID badge holder) delivered to each attendee
success_criteria: ≥ 95% of invited GPI team members attend in‑person (target 115/120)
Average session satisfaction rating ≥ 4.5/5 on post‑event survey
Product Roadmap receives formal sign‑off from all three sub‑team directors by June 15
At least 3 cross‑functional initiatives (e.g., joint feature pilots) are defined and entered into the Action‑Item Tracker
Event stays within the approved budget of $150,000 (±5%)
Net Promoter Score (NPS) for the kickoff ≥ 70
All recorded sessions uploaded and accessible within 48 hours after the event
constraints: Total budget capped at $150,000 (venue, travel, catering, AV, swag, and contingency)
Venue capacity limited to 200 attendees – must manage room assignments and social‑distancing signage
Travel restrictions for two international team members (require visa processing by May 15)
All deliverables must be finalized within a T‑60 planning horizon (i.e., 60 days before June 10)
AV setup must support simultaneous live‑stream to remote participants in three time zones (EST, PST, GMT)
Swag items must be sourced from sustainable vendors and comply with the company’s ESG policy
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed workback plan for the 'TechNova AI Solutions – 2025 Global Product Innovation Annual Kickoff' scenario. Include all major milestones, tasks, owners, dependencies, and dates starting from today (T‑60) through the event dates (June 10‑12, 2025) and post‑event deliverable deadlines. Highlight critical path items, risk mitigation steps, and required approvals. The plan should be formatted as a table or Gantt‑style list suitable for import into a project‑management tool.
